intro: Campanula versicolor subsp. versicolor, commonly known as the variable bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to gardens. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
